metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30851 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A memory corruption vulnerability was addressed with improved locking. This issue is fixed in Safari 15, tvOS 15, watchOS 8, iOS 15 and iPadOS 15. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30851` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8 mdeslaur> webkit2gtk no longer builds on bionic's toolchain

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34.1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
